DataElement.preferredName: Bone Lesion External Spine Pelvis Present Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine the presence of a localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity located outside of a series of bones, muscles, tendons, and other tissues reaching from the base of the skull to the tailbone and the bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bone Lesion External Vertebral Column Pelvis Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of bone._Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface._A series of bones, muscles, tendons, and other tissues reaching from the base of the skull to the tailbone. The vertebral column forms the axis of the skeleton and encloses as well as protects the spinal cord and the fluid surrounding the spinal cord._The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of bone.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of bone.

Property.preferredDefinition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.:A series of bones, muscles, tendons, and other tissues reaching from the base of the skull to the tailbone. The vertebral column forms the axis of the skeleton and encloses as well as protects the spinal cord and the fluid surrounding the spinal cord.:The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.

A series of bones, muscles, tendons, and other tissues reaching from the base of the skull to the tailbone. The vertebral column forms the axis of the skeleton and encloses as well as protects the spinal cord and the fluid surrounding the spinal cord.
The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.
